AllowSimpleDevicePassword.description: Set to '1' to allow simple sequences like 1234
AllowSimpleDevicePassword.title: Allow Simple Device Password

AlphaNumericDevicePasswordRequired.description: Set to '1' if you require alphanumeric password.
AlphaNumericDevicePasswordRequired.title: AlphaNumeric Device Password Required

AttachmentsEnabled.description: Set to '1' if you want to enable attachments in TouchDown.
AttachmentsEnabled.title: Attachments Enabled

DevicePasswordEnabled.description: Set to '1' to enable PIN prompting. If set to '0', TouchDown will not prompt for PIN (even if EAS policies require it)
DevicePasswordEnabled.title: Device Password Enabled

DevicePasswordHistoryCount.description: Set to '0' to not keep any password history.
DevicePasswordHistoryCount.title: Device Password History Count

DisableCleanup.description: Disable user ability to wipe configuration from settings
DisableCleanup.title: Disable Cleanup

DisableCopyPaste.description: If set to '1', users will not be able to copy data from email or paste data into email when composing messages
DisableCopyPaste.title: Disable Copy and Paste

DisableCopyToPhoneBook.description: If set to '1', this will cause TouchDown to never copy contacts to the device phone book
DisableCopyToPhoneBook.title: Disable Copy To PhoneBook

ForcedSMIMEPinTimeout.description: If specified, this policy sets the timeout before TouchDown will prompt for a PIN before using an S.MIME certificate for signing or decryption. If this is set, the user is not allowed to change this timeout.
ForcedSMIMEPinTimeout.title: Forced SMIME PIN Timeout

HideCalendarInfoOnNotificationBar.description: If set to '1', notifications should not show calendar data indicating which appointment is approaching
HideCalendarInfoOnNotificationBar.title: HideCalendarInfoOnNotificationBar

HideEmailInfoOnNotificationBar.description: If set to '1', notifications should not show email data
HideEmailInfoOnNotificationBar.title: Hide Email Info On Notification Bar

HideTaskInfoOnNotificationBar.description: If set to '1', notifications should not show data on tasks
HideTaskInfoOnNotificationBar.title: Hide Task Info On Notification Bar

MaxAttachmentSize.description: Maximum allowed size of attachments to be downloaded or sent, in bytes
MaxAttachmentSize.title: Max Attachment Size (in bytes)

MaxCalendarAgeFilter.description: Integer specifying maximum range of past events to sync. Valid values here are : 0 - unlimited 4 - 2 weeks 5 - 1 month 6 - 3 months 7 - 6 months Note that this will not impact the currently set values by the user if the current values are more restrictive than this value.
MaxCalendarAgeFilter.title: Max Calendar Age Filter

MaxDevicePasswordFailedAttempts.description: The number of failed PIN attempts after which the container data is wiped.
MaxDevicePasswordFailedAttempts.title: Max Device Password Failed Attempts

MaxEmailAgeFilter.description: Integer specifying maximum range of past emails to sync. Valid values here are : 0 - unlimited 1 - 1 day 2 - 3 days 3 - 1 week 4 - 2 weeks 5 - 1 month Note that this will not impact the currently set values by the user if the current values are more restrictive than this value.
MaxEmailAgeFilter.title: Max Email Age Filter

MaxEmailBodyTruncationSize.description: 0 - No Body is fetched 1 - 4k 2 - 5k 3 - 7k 4 - 10k 5 - 20k 6 - 50k 7 - 100k 8 - unlimited Raw integral values representing the size in bytes may also be used. But if you set it to something like 3000 (above 8), TouchDown will limit to the closest kilobyte unit shown above. Ideally you want to use the codes above.  Note that this ONLY limits the upper limit the user chooses, and does not enforce the exact value. This means if you set it to 7, the user himself can choose to limit to any value less than 100k.
MaxEmailBodyTruncationSize.title: Max Email Body Truncation Size

MaxInactivityTimeDeviceLock.description: Set this to the number of minutes for the password to timeout.
MaxInactivityTimeDeviceLock.title: Max Inactivity Time Device Lock (minutes)

MinDevicePasswordComplexCharacters.description: Number of different character classes required in the password. NOTE: To be implemented, current implementation is deficient
MinDevicePasswordComplexCharacters.title: Minimum Device Password Complex Characters

MinDevicePasswordLength.description: Set this to the minimum password length
MinDevicePasswordLength.title: Minimum Device Password Length

RequireManualSyncOnRoaming.description: If set to 'true', automatic sync is disabled when device is found to be roaming
RequireManualSyncOnRoaming.title: Require Manual Sync On Roaming

ResetPolicies.description: Specify 1 here if you want touchdown to always apply the full list of policies overwriting existing ones
ResetPolicies.title: Reset Policies

SMIMEDecryptionCert1PFX.description: Set this cert to the certificate that should be used ONLY for decryption. For example, prior certs which may have expired. You can set up to 5 decryption certs
SMIMEDecryptionCert1PFX.title: SMIME Decryption Cert 1 PFX

SMIMEDefaultCertPFX.description: If there is a single certificate for both SMIME Signing and Encryption, set this and associate this with the SMIME cert's corresponding value.
SMIMEDefaultCertPFX.title: SMIME Default Cert PFX

SMIMEEncryptionCertPFX.description: If there are separate certs for encryption and signing, set this value to the encryption certificate. NOT APPLICABLE IF YOU SET SMIME Default Cert PFX
SMIMEEncryptionCertPFX.title: SMIME Encryption Cert PFX

SMIMESigningCertPFX.description: If there are separate certs for encryption and signing, set this value to the Signing certificate. NOT APPLICABLE IF YOU SET SMIME Default Cert PFX
SMIMESigningCertPFX.title: SMIME Signing Cert PFX

SetPlainTextSignature.description: Set the signature on the application to be used with plain text email.
SetPlainTextSignature.title: Set Plain Text Signature

SetSignature.description: Set the signature on the application.
SetSignature.title: Set Signature

SetSuppressions.description: The list of suppression codes to apply to TouchDown, to prevent TouchDown from displaying certain options to the end user. The list of all suppression codes available are present in http://tinyurl.com/tdstart The list of codes should be comma separated, with at least one comma in the string.
SetSuppressions.title: Set Suppressions

SuppressApplicationPIN.description: Set to '1' if you want the application to not show a PIN prompt if you don't want EAS PIN to be enforced by TouchDown. This is useful if the MDM decides to enforce a device level PIN.
SuppressApplicationPIN.title: Suppress Application PIN

deviceid.description: The device ID to be used when connecting from TouchDown on this device.
deviceid.title: Device ID

domain.description: The domain value to be used for this users account. Note you should not typically specify this entry if the userid is the email address of the user.
domain.title: Domain

server.description: Enter the server name of the exchange server.  TouchDown will automatically prefix with https:// Note that if you are connecting to a lotus traveler server, you may have to suffix the server name with /servlet/traveler
server.title: Server

userid.description: Normally you would put in the users email address here, and that would mean you should not specify the domain entry. If your server requires the user to login with domain\alias, enter the alias here
userid.title: User Id
